section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 15. Pregnancy, Childbirth, and the Puerperium > o. The Peripartum and Postpartum Periods > 1) Peripartum and Postpartum periods

content.full_text: The postpartum period begins immediately after delivery and continues for six weeks following delivery. The peripartum period is defined as the last month of pregnancy to five months postpartum. (Evidence: pg no: 69, L84-L85)
content.summary: Official definitions of postpartum and peripartum periods for coding purposes (Evidence: pg no: 69, L84-L85)
key_concepts: Postpartum period: immediately after delivery to 6 weeks (Evidence: pg no: 69, L85)
Peripartum period: last month of pregnancy to 5 months postpartum (Evidence: pg no: 69, L85)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Postpartum period is immediately after delivery for six weeks (Evidence: pg no: 69, L85)
detailed_rules.explanation: The official postpartum period for coding purposes begins immediately after delivery and lasts for six weeks (Evidence: pg no: 69, L85)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Peripartum period is last month of pregnancy to five months postpartum (Evidence: pg no: 69, L85)
detailed_rules.explanation: The peripartum period extends from the last month of pregnancy through five months after delivery (Evidence: pg no: 69, L85)
